com.mobius.vdrapi.callbacks
Interface IHasDownloadLimit

public interface IHasDownloadLimit

A class implements IHasDownloadLimit to enable it to provide Download Limit information, if necessary.

The Download Limit refers to the maximum number of pages that a single command can download to the viewer.

See Also:
CreatePageGroupCommand, INeedObjectWithDownloadLimit, A graphical representation of how CreatePageGroupCommand implements IHasDownloadLimit

Method Summary
 int getDownloadLimit()
          Provides the CreatePageGroup command with the DownloadLimit value.
 boolean isDownloadTruncated()
          Once a download has been executed, a caller of the CreatePageGroup command uses this method to determine whether the number of requested pages is greater than the DownloadLimit.
 void setDownloadTruncated(boolean value)
          Sets the "Download is Truncated" flag.
 

Method Detail

getDownloadLimit

public int getDownloadLimit()
Provides the CreatePageGroup command with the DownloadLimit value. If the ObjectWithDownloadLimit doesn't exist, or DownloadLimit is set to zero, a single command can download any number of pages.

The default value is zero (no limit).

isDownloadTruncated

public boolean isDownloadTruncated()
Once a download has been executed, a caller of the CreatePageGroup command uses this method to determine whether the number of requested pages is greater than the DownloadLimit. This method checks if the download has been terminated by examining the "Download is Truncated" flag. If the flag is set to True, isDownloadTruncated is set to True.

The caller may use this flag to provide an appropriate warning message to end users, indicating that the number of documents retrieved by their search request exceeds the maximum number they can download at one time.

The default value is False.

setDownloadTruncated

public void setDownloadTruncated(boolean value)
Sets the "Download is Truncated" flag. The CreatePageGroup command calls this method if a non-zero DownloadLimit value is exceeded during download. If this is the case, the "Download is Truncated" flag is set to True, and the download is terminated. The default value is False.
